appearances.title: West Coast News Wrap : KTVU : January 9, 2026 7:30pm-8:00pm PST
appearances.snippet: washington senator patty murray supporting rayfield's decision, saying, quote, under the trump administrationdhs is nothing more than a miserable propaganda machine. we need answers and accountability. our cities are not training grounds for trigger happy dhs agents. congress member emily randall, sharing a similar sentiment, writing in part that kristi noem, lawless agents are out of control and that enough is enough. referencing thursday's shooting in portland and the deadly shooting of a minneapolis woman by ice agents on wednesday. the very same day, masked agents in an unmarked car arrested three people on seattle's aurora avenue. mayor katie wilson posting a video to facebook calling the arrest an abuse of power, but also acknowledging seattle's limited authority regarding the actions of federal agencies. >> so i'm working with police chief barnes, city attorney evans. immigrant rights groups and local leaders to identify every possible legal argument, public resource, and creative tool we can use to keep the people of seattle safe. >> and that was fox thirteen's frankie thompson report

appearances.title: U.S. Senate U.S. Senate : CSPAN2 : January 12, 2026 2:59pm-6:56pm EST
appearances.snippet: i want to thank the house chairman, tom cole, and ranking member, rosa delora, and senator patty murrayrom whom we just heard, the vice chair, including over the holidays to get these bills done. we also could not have done it without the extraordinary staff that we are blessed to have, some of whom stayed up literally all night working on these bills. we also, mr. president, worked closely with the administration, which has issued a statement in support of passage of this package. mr. president, the appropriations mini package that's before us will actually reduce discretionary spending while better focusing spending on the key priorities of the american people. let me highlight just a if you have those priorities. the commerce, justice, and science bill invests in america's economic development and trade relationships. it supports our state and local law enforcement, including through the burn formula program that supports a range of law enforcement activities from prosecution to crime prevention. it funds space exploration and research in critical, science, and technological fields.

appearances.title: U.S. Senate U.S. Senate : CSPAN2 : January 13, 2026 2:15pm-6:58pm EST
appearances.snippet: ranking member -- in other words, the ranking democrat, is my friend, the senator from washington, patty murray we have conferenced that bill, mr. president. what does that mean? well, that means that all the democratic members and all the republican members of the energy and water development committee have worked out our differences. doesn't mean we're all happy, but we've worked them all out. we've also worked out our differences with the house, the republicans and the democrats in the house. i'm not saying everybody is happy, but they've accepted the bill. we've reached an agreement. and in fact the house has already passed it. and we're going to be considering that bill, the energy and water bill, here in a couple of days. and i just wanted to quickly -- i'll speak more later, perhaps -- i just wanted to quickly highlight what we're going to be voting on here in the next couple days. the bill is $58 billion. that's less than the current budget. i'm very proud of that. i said at the very beginning of this process i was not going to approve a budget that did anything but spend less. we have
